intro: Yinshania qianningensis, commonly known as the Qianning yinshania, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
